intro: Adyseton saxatile, commonly known as the saxatile adyseton, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, preferring well-drained environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, adapted to reduce water loss in arid conditions. Adyseton saxatile produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or white, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
